headline: Coronavirus in Ohio Wednesday update: Fewer than 830 cases reported
author: Joe Clark
sentences: While Columbus dropped its mask mandate Monday, all four major Columbus-area health systems — OhioHealth, Mount Carmel Health System, Nationwide Children’s and Ohio State’s Wexner Medical Center — will continue to require patients, visitors, and staff to mask up, according to spokespersons from each health entity.

Jon Husted and former state health director Amy Acton appeared at a lectern in the Ohio Statehouse, warning of an imminent threat posed by COVID-19, a mysterious respiratory illness spreading in other countries and gaining a foothold in the U.S.
The department reported 1,765 people started the vaccination process, bringing the total to 7,246,279 which is 61.99% of the state’s population.
